title: Mud and Quicksand
author: ThePlayerA
body:
This pull adds mud and quicksand environmental floors. These floors slow units but don't damage them. These can provide mapmakers with a way to slow player units down without damaging them. They also add more aesthetic and functional variety to the environments of maps. Quicksand and mud provide a boost to water extractors due to their high moisture content. These floors can provide new options for building defenses as players can take advantage of the slowing effects.

![demo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71131193/92937939-4bf3f000-f48f-11ea-86a5-de3d88c0e08c.gif)

title: Block Fields for Modding
author: sk7725
body:
+ `quickRotate`: whether the block can be rotated with R(or Binding.rotateplaced) + Scroll Wheel.
This is because modded blocks are sometimes not meant to be rotated after placed, and a block cannot tell if it has been rotated unless it keeps track of its rotation, so in some cases it is better if the block is just not rotated at all after placed.
+ `rotateArrow`: whether the block placement is guided by the arrow icon.
This is because some modded block are using the `rotation` of the block in an "unintended" way, such as making only whether it was vertically or horizontally placed count(a.k.a only `rotation%2` matters), and in some cases it just makes sense to get rid of the arrow icon.

title: Make payload units able to pick up bigger blocks based on its capacity
author: sk7725
body:
Make payload units be able to pick up blocks of sizes that are smaller or equal to its capacity, not a fixed number(2).   
Units will now be able to pick up blocks if `size^2`(area) is less or equal to its current capacity left.   
1. This will impose that the unit and block storage will be shared, which may be logical(if not, just remove `- pay.payloade().size`)   
2. This will have no effect of `mega`'s capability, as its capacity is 4(although if there are units on board it will only be able to pick up 1x1)   
3. This will let modded units be able to carry meltdowns, or give them more freedom

title: Server disable schematic option
author: j-vds
body:
Some servers like to disable schematics ex to prevent (NSFW) pixelart.
And this was also requested by some plugin makers.

It works like the `reactorExplosions` rule. You can disable schematics via:
`rules add schematicAllowed true`

## How does it affect the player?
1. The schematic button is disabled or greyed out.
![afbeelding](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38380578/90676192-e7f95580-e25b-11ea-8a31-b0449285590e.png)

2. If you use the schematic keybind `T` or copy  keybind `F` an error message gets printed on the screen.
![afbeelding](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38380578/90676274-095a4180-e25c-11ea-89d1-a1e5c1237252.png)

title: Remove mindustry.ru from global server list
author: BasedUser
body:
There's way too much issues with this server from the russian community: mindustry.ru is not only poorly moderated and extremely understaffed, but it also drives people out of the mindustry community, with half of the server's players being afk, permabanned, toxic or all of the above, as well as milking itself with its own "shop".

Hence this pull request, where mindustry.ru is removed for not only the newer players' sanities, but for players of all backgrounds from \#русский, reddit, the unofficial mindustry VK group, and even englishspeaking players in \#multiplayer, \#mindustry, etc.

title: Add a railgun turret
author: genNAowl
body:
Based on these two suggestions: 
https://github.com/Anuken/Mindustry-Suggestions/issues/96
https://github.com/Anuken/Mindustry-Suggestions/issues/330

Stats: 

Health: 1350 (higher than ripple and cyclone but less than fuse)
Size: 3x3 (because Mindustry needs more 3x3 turrets; There a 4(1x1)s, 4(2x2)s, and soon to be 4(4x4)s, but only 3(3x3)s)
Build Cost: 200 lead (It uses energy to fire), 80 titanium (like ripple), 125 silicone (like ripple but graph is now silicone)
Power Use: 450 power/s (bigger than lancer, but smaller than meltdown)
Range: 31.25 blocks (smaller than ripple but bigger than every other turret in the game)
Inaccuracy: 0 degrees (kind of like a sniper)
Shots/s: 0.1 (slow shooting, like a sniper)
Targets Air: yes (its not an artillery turret)
Targets Ground: yes (its not just an anti-air turret)

Ammo: (shoots all hard/dense materials)
- Graphite: 300 damage
- Titanium: 400 damage
- Thorium: 500 damage
- Surge Alloy: 250 damage (because the shock effect doubles the damage and also damages things around it)

Boosters: (I decided to make liquids optional because this is a 3x3 turret, not a 4x4)
- Water: 1.4x fire rate
- Cryofluid: 1.9x fire rate

Finally, the pierce effect: 
 I tried hard to make this turret not too overpowered, but ended buffing it multiple times because it was outclassed by the ripple in almost every way (Dps, Range, etc.). 
Note that the pierce effect actually has a cap relative to the current lifetime of the bullet. Basically, every time a bullet hits an object, It loses a certain amount of lifetime. Also, this bullet does not add an entity to the "collided" list, and so may actually hit bigger entities multiple times, dealing extra damage. On the other hand, this was countered by giving the bullet a pierce cap (as I explained above). 
I made this turret to be like a upgraded lancer (with the pierce, and the fact that it needs power to shoot), but it is still unique due to its pierce cap, bullet projectile, and long range. 

Current Sprite:
![railgun](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/68400583/90067806-7f7f0700-dca4-11ea-95d0-50a0f16051f3.png)

I left the sprite in the raw-assets bin so this can be merged anytime. **Please give me feedback on the sprite in the comments**

For now, this will be a draft, as It probably isn't balanced yet and the sprite isn't very good. (Also, I'm unsure whether @Anuken will like the idea)

title: Plastanium conveyors are worse than titaniums in every condition.
author: ghost
body:
Plastanium conveyor is only good when compared to titanium one with unlimited item source because it instantly fills plastanium conveyors but in reality its worse because nothing can instantly fill plastanium conveyors and in a condition which we use boosted airblast its a bit worse than titanium conveyor. I didn't test the other drills/production outputs but i guess it gets worse. Increasing the speed of it, the items get to where they should earlier and maybe makes it better than titanium conveyors because they almost have same speed but plastanium conveyors also have to fill up thats why currently if you have high throughput use plastanium, if you have low throughput use titanium because with low throughput it takes so long for 10 items to fill and go to somewhere but maybe increasing the speed makes it similar to titanium with low throughput. The distance between the two points are also very important because of the high speed it goes to somewhere so fast even if it takes so long to fill.

Current situation:
Plastanium: Has to fill (Bad) + low speed (Bad) (Requires very high throughput that is only done with unlimited item source to be better than titanium conveyors)
Titanium: Doesn't has to fill (Good) + low speed (Bad) (Speed is a bit worse than plastanium but that doesnt matter so much)

PR situation:
Plastanium: Has to fill (Bad) + high speed (Good) (Requires good throughput to be better than titanium and its actually easy to do it)
Titanium: Doesn't has to fill (Good) + low speed (Bad) (Compared to Plastanium)

If you implement this PR both conveyors will be good in certain situations (Plastanium at higher throughputs and Titanium at lower throughputs)

Notes:
• I increased plast conveyor speed by %25 but i didnt test it so it could be OP or maybe still similar to titanium.
• Maybe instead of increasing the speed you can lower the item capacity from 10 to 5 or something.

title: Update Tetrative Reconstructor's Liquid Capacity
author: ghost
body:
I increased the liquid capacity of tetrative reconstructor because when we use boosted overdrive projector or large overdrive projector, tetrative reconstructor stops because i think it requires so much liquid in a sec and the capacity cant handle that (180+/sec for a capacity of 10.) and to make it so it can handle it i increased the capacity. I don't know if this will fix the issue because i couldnt try it.

Default capacity: 10
Suggested capacity: 15

If 15 doesnt work then we may have to increase it even more because im sure the issue is related to liquids and i think its about liquid capacity.

title: Boost pyratite
author: genNAowl
body:
Pyratite needs to be buffed. You can find the reasons here: https://github.com/Anuken/Mindustry-Suggestions/issues/80

Its Annoying to Make, and when you make it, there isn't much of it: 
Changed the craft time for mixers to 1 sec. (excluding cryo-mixers)

Energy Sources:
Buffed differentials to make them low maintenance (as no one really uses them). Also increased the energy output for all gens that use pyratite. 

Ammo: 
Made the status effect "burning" much more powerful. Also buffed all "Incendiary"-type bullets. 

These changes probably needs rebalancing, as I probably made pyratite too good. Hopefully in the meantime, people will start to use pyratite as something other than just an ingredient in blast.

title: Helper turrets
author: ThePythonGuy3
body:
I added `helper` boolean to turrets, making the turrets with `helper = true;` follow you mouse on PC, point at enemies on Mobile, and shoot if you are shooting.     

Here you can see "Tracker", the new turret that I added for this PR. (It has no sprite because you can't pack sprites right now, but it is on the PR `assets-raw/sprites/blocks/turrets` folder):

![image](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ThePythonGuy3/Mindustryv6Resprite/master/Mindustry%202020-07-06%2016-33-14.gif)

The sprite is actually this:

![image](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ThePythonGuy3/Mindustry/helper-turrets/core/assets-raw/sprites/blocks/turrets/tracker.png)

To avoid major problems and bugs, the helper turrets work as a normal turret while on multiplayer. (I havent tested this because multiplayer is broken, but it should)

I also added Tracker to the english bundle.

title: #Refactoring & Design Pattern
author: huiung
body:
#Refactoring
1.Used refactoring operations
 Extract Method

2.Classes which have been changed
  Effects.java, WeaphonsComp.java

3.Why were they refactored
-Effects.java has duplicated codes -> extract method
-WeaphonsComp.java's update method is so complex -> extract method each of role


#Desing Pattern
1. Used Design Pattern
    Singleton

2. Classes which have been changed
   MusicControl.java, Control.java

3. Why used this Design Pattern
   I think that MusciControl class need only one for running
   but, it can be created more than one because it isn't singleton.
   applying singleton is effective regarding to memory and this hazards

title: Reduce voteCooldown
author: Kieaer
body:
### Reason
If the vote fails to expel the griefer, during the cool time, the griefers can destroy everything.
It's really enough time.

The best solution is a remove voteCooldown or 5~10 second cooldown.

title: Reduce the camera shake generated by salvos
author: ThePythonGuy3
body: It becomes very difficult to try and build things precisely around salvos, specifically in attack maps, because they shoot very fast and cause a lot of camera shake, which makes very difficult to place conveyors or turrets around them.

too responsive

title: Remove kr server
author: Kieaer
body:
# Too many griefers
Players didn't want to grief on their main server, so the users seemed to be doing it on my server.

# Admins are volunteers.
The plugin solves most of the problems, but on average 7 hours a day, about 13 people come to griefing the server __every day__.

Yeah. Mindustry is Sandbox defence game.
So there's a limit to plugins. (Unless I make AI)
Admins have been busy and tired of catching griefers every day, not playing games.

# Not many multiplayer-only maps
There are more cases of building a meltdown or wave skip in just 15 waves.
Most discord/steam map isn't designed for multiplayer.

The solution is to create a map, but unlike other servers, my server is a solo development, so I don't have enough time to do plugin and server monitoring and map production at the same time.

# When will this server come back?
After making new server contents
ex) Bullet hell (like a anuke's other games)

title: [QOL] Quick Upgrade Utility Implementation
author: zatnas
body:
ORIGINAL:
![Peek 2020-05-28 12-03](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16971676/83099378-c9157800-a0df-11ea-9579-6070917ab8a9.gif)
UPDATE 1:
![Peek 2020-05-30 10-30](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16971676/83317777-e1150500-a261-11ea-92e1-d5986d9f683d.gif)
UPDATE 2: Mobile
![Peek 2020-05-31 18-02](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16971676/83349650-253efd00-a369-11ea-9491-57c024a0dfe4.gif)

A preview of what it looks like.

How it works using the default buttons, you hold down `Left Mouse Button`, and then hold down `Middle Mouse Button`, and then you drag across. If you want to force `Thorium Tier` blocks like ArmoredConveyor and ArmoredConduit to every block, you press `Left Control`.

As for mobile. When hammer is toggled, toggling it again will toggle the upgrade. You can select as shown in the desktop version, long press, then drag across. As for forced mode in desktop version, you can toggle the lock icon at the bottom left.

~~Currently doesn't work with multiblocks as shown in the end of the GIF.~~

An alternative implementation to https://github.com/Anuken/Mindustry/pull/1009 and https://github.com/Anuken/Mindustry/pull/1722

EDIT: Some questions from Discord if I ever do a mobile version. Since this is a draft, I can put it on the TODO list. Originally I wanted to implement for desktop version first, mobile version in another PR. 

TODO:
- [X] Support Multiblocks
- [X] Mobile Version Support

title: [QOL] Clear Last Config Key Implementation
author: zatnas
body:
Continuation of https://github.com/Anuken/Mindustry/pull/2065. I messed up the commits.

![Peek 2020-05-20 12-02](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16971676/82403919-92fa4780-9a92-11ea-9c5d-389e2dea9128.gif)
The GIF above only shows ItemBridge. But it works with all saved configured blocks. Sorter, Inverted Sorter, Item Source, Liquid Source, and Unloader. All works with this.

When your current `Placing Mode` block is one of the stated above and you press `Clear Building` key, if there is **configuration set as the default**, it will be **cleared  first**. If there is **no configuration set as default**, the key will **clear building as usual**.

TODO:

title: Add throughput module to sandbox blocks
author: Quezler
body:
> when playing around with #1954 i needed more-accurate-then-eyesight measurements.

so i started working on idea's for a measurement block sprite, and how it should function (sorters are instant / needs to support liquids / maybe like a junction / etc), but then it just dawned on me i could just add it to the `item` & `liquid` `sources` & `voids`:

basically those `4` blocks now measure their throughput over a period of `10 seconds`.
(during the **initial 10 seconds** the bar will slowly fill up, indicating it is measuring/loading)

> cursor is over the liquid void next to the cryofluid mixer (shown below)
![Screen Shot 2020-05-01 at 11 18 52](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/80795713-95f1ce80-8b9d-11ea-9626-4e1153daaef7.png)

during my limited amount of testing it does appear to flicker a bit.
(like between `4.2` and `4.3` for normal conveyors, but that [somewhat makes sense](https://github.com/Anuken/Mindustry/blob/master/core/src/mindustry/world/blocks/distribution/Conveyor.java#L53))

![Screen Shot 2020-05-01 at 11 10 35](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/80795543-1106b500-8b9d-11ea-90e9-d824a49eb5d6.png)

i am not sure how large of a performance impact this would have, nor if the measurement frame is of the right size, it takes a while to load but it seams nice to measure over a longer period of time, but its entirely up for debate.

> i'll probably post a video of this in action in `#pull-requests` later today 🥔

title: [doodle] terrain schematics
author: Quezler
body:
> this is just me playing around with the code to get closer to the below explained goal

![Screen Shot 2020-04-26 at 12 38 12](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/80305091-f8705680-87ba-11ea-8b17-42c0ea5cc450.png)

_basically, allowing any block, floor & overlay in a schematic:_

Currently we have `Loadouts.java`, which contains as you know the starting core layouts, but that only consists of normal blocks, and its hardcoded to place ores under drills.

I propose embedding support into schematics for floor & overlay layers as well.

The reason i'm diving into this now is since i'm planning to explore the 6.0 `tile.setFloor` calls, and it would be nice to have some predefined "ruins" or "decorated ore patches" that are placable on the map (by the server) in realtime.

And to do that i'll either have to modify the schematic format / come up with some sort of editor generation setting for predefined embeds / create like a secondary map to be loaded in that functions like a spritemap of some sort that i'll have to map out / etc, basically the schematic approach sounded most logical.

I don't really intend for players to be able to use it in single player or multiplayer, but while developing this it does have some promising usages for the ingame editor.

The reason i'm leaving this draft here is for discussion on what would be a nice approach, since i'd rather not bodge in my own hacky solution that lack official support, i'm willing to bet that more people find this idea interesting, and thus a more official implementation would be required.

Thanks for reading, please leave a reaction (either emoji or text)

**tldr** easily defining structures that use all 3 layers that the server can paste into the world 🥔 

> needless to say this code currently only sorta does the graphical part, not much else (yet)

title: Steady block inventory.
author: profpoopagain
body:
Added a delay before the disappearence of an item from a block's
inventory causes the BlockInventoryFragment to rebuild its table.

This is mainly for the case where resources are moving directly through a container, in and immediately out.  Before this patch it would be hard to read the constantly rebuilding table or select resources to withdraw.

This patch causes one more allocation (one use of "new") per instance of BlockInventoryFragment.  As far as I can see you only get one of these objects when someone clicks a block and it persists until something else is selected, so I though the allocation was probably acceptable.

Ran ./gradelw desktop:test and it didn't complain. ./gradlew desktop:run does what I described if you play around with containers in sandbox mode.

title: Spelling update in Portuguese (Brazil)
author: kaiodcosta
body:
Orthographic updates were made using the recent orthographic construction of the Portuguese language.

18: Lack of complement. In this sentence, one must have the direct meaning to the map in question.

102: Keep has been replaced by have. And this sentence started with a formal language and should not be changed to an informal language.

139: In this case, the tree is made of Technologies.

of course @Anuken mentioned he didn't like the idea of teleporters, but this would at least put the aforementioned community at ease a bit if the poll does end up in its removal, i believe the chance of this getting merged is fairly low (target branch is also questionable), so i will just leave it here for now 🙂 (close it if you so please*)

title: [quality of life] resuming construction in bulk
author: Quezler
body:
Currently when you run out of building resources (or when you die) half way through construction you're left with one or more build blocks with barely any progress, and the only way to complete what was intended is to either click all of them by hand, or delete them in order to replace them.

This draft allows people to resume the build by allowing it to be added to the build queue if the block being constructed matches the current type.

Some things that are up for debate:
- it only allows the original block to be constructed, no wall/conveyor/drill hotswap upgrading.
- it keeps the rotation the original block was in, could either be annoying or fairly useful.
- and of course the code, no idea if i thought of everything, haven't tested it a lot yet. 

![Apr-03-2020 16-03-46](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/78368965-c48f8000-75c4-11ea-9ba6-bdfc560e73d8.gif)
> gif shows me running out, then scavenging copper to resume via dragging a new line 🥔

title: Add Category Key Bindings
author: cyrusduong
body:
Related https://github.com/Anuken/Mindustry-Suggestions/issues/41

Creates the ability to re-assign at least the category hotkeys. 

This is a passive change. The user will have to manually go re-assign the category keys from their default (will continue to act acts like block selection in master). 

If they reassign the keys they can then use a different key combo to select blocks.

For example: 

1. A user rebinds category 3 to the key 'B' (conveyors category assuming the full tech tree is unlocked).
2. When a user is in-game. They can select the 3rd block in that category by pressing the combo `B-3`. 

Tested on Windows using `gradlew.bat desktop:run`.

title: [serverlist] nydus
author: Quezler
body: > nydus server submission //\\(oo)/\\\\ ![Screen Shot 2020-02-23 at 10 05 38](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/75109497-34086c00-5624-11ea-84e2-71b8c16fc456.png) using a non default port to allow rewiring which server it point to on my end: the reasoning behind this is to be able to switch the port away from the main server in the event that i'm testing a (minigame) plugin that needs a bunch of players, so i can leach of the nydus entry in the global server list. i intend to keep a close eye on the stream of (new) players that join through this new listing, i already have a small fleet of admins (which i intend to grow more over time), as well as developing new(er) antigrief measures as reaction(s) to what happens on this server substrate. furthermore i was curious about the "legality" of being allowed to turn off the port under certain circumstances (huge influx of griefers / filled to capacity / etc), since the `SERVERLIST.md` does not mention requiring a 24/7 uptime sla, so i am curious on your standpoint on it. also, the player limit (as can be seen above) is currently 11, which is not "entirely" true: ![Screen Shot 2020-02-23 at 10 16 51](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/75109662-ac236180-5625-11ea-84bc-7eed801f194e.png) (there's a "secret" double cap in place, so players who aren't scared of the player cap being full can still get in if they want to, this change grandfathers the change that admins can always join) of course i plan to adjust the player limit over time based on the influx of new players if this pull gets accepted. that's about it, thanks for reading, let me know if you (or anyone) has questions :) 🥔 > oh, and with `modified jar` i mean that i have some server sided enhancements in place to slightly modify the experience, while staying within the constraints what the server can pull off without players requiring custom clients and/or mods.

title: Threshold Unloader
author: InvalidError404
body:
An evolved version of my Max Unloader. This variant starts unloading the most plentiful item only when the storage it is attached to is filled above the selected threshold of 0%, 25%, 50% or 75%. The threshold is applied on a per-item basis for vaults (won't unload any item that is below threshold) and total basis for launchers since launch is triggered on total. Behaves like the Max Unloader when set to 0% since it reuses the same max search function, albeit with the initial max value set to capacity*threshold for vaults so items with insufficient quantity get ignored.

Basically, this is an overflow gate for containers that lets you pick how empty (or full) you would like to keep the vault it is attached to.

![ThreshUnloader](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/60593448/74092369-c6d7d100-4a90-11ea-8c04-e2cab71ec8cd.png)
In the Tar Field run I started to test the threshold unloader one last time before opening my push, my core spawned in the SW corner, so I had to setup this little relay/sorting station in the corridor leading to large open area in the south.

The copper, lead, titanium and silicon unloaders are feeding surge alloy smelters as usual, a pair of regular non-sorted unloaders trickle-feeds my core a healthy mix of whatever passes by, one threshold unloader set at 50% lets the vault fill up to at least 50% of any one item before kicking in so it does not interfere with any items I am low on (it is unloading a mix of plastanium, thorium and lead in this case, the three resources above 50% of 1000) and a backup threshold unloader kicks in at 75% to help ensure mass receivers never run out of room to dump their loads.

title: Trim schematic string before calling Base64Decoder
author: danieljennings
body: This fixes getting the "Length of Base64 encoded input string is not a multiple of 4." error when importing schematics that have whitespace at the start/end of them, which is easy to accidentally have without knowing by when copying the schematic codes from random different web pages.

title: [byte logic] 103 master merge
author: Quezler
body:
> sat down for about an hour meticulously merging stuff by hand, this version compiles

some stuff is commented out (or even removed) to assist with compilation:
- `buildTable`
- `buildConfiguration`
- some @ annotation tags
- probably some more stuff
- pretty sure i forgot about some code
- some of it is marked with the `fixme` tag, intelij will know how to find them

as mentioned above, this version compiles, that's all it does, expect a fair amount of logic within it to be broken to any possible degree, i am fairly unfamilair with the byte logic branch (heck, i first ran it this morning before merging in the master branch), but the existence of this pull will likely assist those who can squash the last bugs in it, since the worst part (merging) is behind them 🙂 

![Screen Shot 2020-02-08 at 06 56 37](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/74080065-51441480-4a40-11ea-917b-0763bed18c1c.png)

> note: i currently have no intention to do (much) more on this, i'm basically giving this pull away to those that have it in them to actually iron out the bugs caused by the master merge 😗

title: New storage block: Max Unloader
author: InvalidError404
body:
This update implements a new unloader that dumps most abundant item first out of the container it is attached to which should help players manage container overflows.

I could have added rotation in case multiple items are at max capacity, though the primary purpose of this block is to avoid getting there in the first place since you are kind of screwed no matter what when ingress bandwidth > egress bandwidth anyway.

Needs a sprites atlas rebuild, new icon included - added to mine by hand since I could not get the image packer tool to work properly.

Here's a screen crop of Max Unloader in action:
![MaxUnloader Action](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/60593448/73913224-7a1faa80-4884-11ea-828c-4e8b9dda6dcf.png)

Max unloader is only touching the three resources that are at ~320.

title: Improved ItemModule::take() behavior
author: InvalidError404
body:
The original take() behavior spams items in whatever order they appear in the items list until each index is depleted, which is problematic when non-specific unloaders are competing against dedicated unloaders for a low-index resources.

My modification makes the take() loop persistent so take() will do complete laps around the item list starting from wherever the previous call returned from, never repeating the same item twice in a row unless there is nothing else to return. A significant improvement IMO.

How is this an improvement? With the original behavior, if you converge a bunch of belts on a storage block or launcher, want to unload a few belts of specific resources (ex.: copper, lead, silicon and titanium for surge alloy) and pass everything else including overflows along using non-specific unloaders, you are out of luck when the resources you want are at the top of the list since most of those will get swept away by non-specific unloaders. With the rotating take(), non-specific unloaders are equal-opportunity across all available resources, which gives single-resource unloaders that many more chances to unload more of their resources before non-specific unloaders get to them. It also reduces the rate at which items further down the list that may hardly ever get touched by the existing implementation will race toward the storage block's cap. The even drain across all items will help prevent things like mass driver stalls due to receivers filling up with an excess resource that isn't getting cleared.

It would be even nicer if dedicated unloaders had priority over non-specific ones (non-specific unloaders don't touch resources with dedicated unloaders unless the dedicated unloaders are overflowing), though that would require a rework beyond my current "getting the stupid IDE and tool chains to work" level of familiarity with Java development.

To sum it up: trivial change, big impact for people who like mixing belts and sorting them out with unloaders.

title: [quality of life] server list categories
author: Quezler
body:
> graphical prototype, contains duplicate code and probably some un-caught edge cases

splits the server list in 3 distinct categories:
- local servers
- remote servers
- global servers

global servers and local servers are no longer part of the same internal "list" so you can still press/see/find the refresh local games button if there is a global server in the list.

local servers have been put way up top, because if there is a local game available on your network its pretty likely that its your own testing server or a server you would probably want to join for a plethora of reasons, justifying them being above your own remote server list.

global servers go at the bottom, since you'd want your own server list first, so you don't have to scroll for the servers you actually care about.

![Feb-02-2020 15-48-01](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/73610091-271fcc00-45d4-11ea-9566-2a8ba7bcd967.gif)

🥔 
> and yes, at the time of typing the potato i remembered i didn't use the `bundle.properties`

About #1112: I kindly suggest closing that PR. It would require major effort to fix these mostly bad translations. It might be more efficient to spend that effort on writing the missing translations from scratch.

Hopefully, with the outstanding PRs for bundle_de.properties being closed, people will find it easier to contribute to this translation.

title: gitignore - adding mods/ and *.bat
author: PetrGasparik
body:
Hi,
please accept this update, which adds to .gitignore following
`mods/` - obvious reasons, there will be no mods in Mindustry and github 
`*.bat` - that's what I use for effective contributing (remote pull etc), I believe there will be no *.bat file in future

This change should make no harm to anyone and it will help me a lot :)

title: controlled script loading
author: deltanedas
body:
If `mainScript` is defined, it will just load the scripts/<mainScript>.js file instead of all files in scripts/
Also lets mods use `require("script");` to load files under scripts, at their discretion.

CURRENTLY NO SECURITY AT ALL //todo //pls check maybe arc does a thing

-------
scripts/main.js is now required. it will be loaded first, after that you can use `require("script")` for scripts/script.js, `require("folder/script")` for scripts/folder/script.js, `require("mod/script")`, etc.
please do not do `require("main")` it will stack overflow

title: [Added] Dedicated Players command
author: Vam-Jam
body:
**What does it add**
Add's a 'players' command for servers to use. Lists info such as username, id, ip and if they are an admin.

**Why add it?**
Currently you can view the current players with 'status', but it only display's a minimal amount of info. Along with that it's not clear that there is a player command, even if status does it. A command dedicated to listing players is always useful.

**Does it compile and work?**
Tested local host (server build)
No players joined, 0 users
Player joined, 1 users
Player left, 0 users

title: [quality of life] impact reactor startup sequence
author: Quezler
body:
https://feathub.com/Anuken/Mindustry/+626

changes it so the impact reactor needs to be full of blast compound in order to begin starting up.
(once its startup animation has started it will continue spinning with any amount of blast*)

this should help greatly since impact reactors tend to omnomnom away if there's only 1 in them.
and it might also make it a bit easier to spot (potential) throughput issues, among other things.

![block-impact-reactor-full](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/73294190-9d53b580-4205-11ea-832a-70b7715a2b83.png)

the orange "cells" on batteries now change from black to orange depending on their buffered power (power stored).

title: [quality of life] mechpad checkpointing
author: Quezler
body:
Currently if you want to spawn from a new mech pad you have to:
`build it > power it > use it`

And if your mech is already the one the pad you placed spawns:
`build it > power it > use it > use it`

This pull changes it so you can "tap" a (powered) mech pad while outside of its "use" range to set your spawn there for your next death(s):
`build it > power it > tap it`

(might not be that mobile friendly since they tend to move onto the pad a little more eagerly)

**video**
in [discord](https://discordapp.com/channels/391020510269669376/663853133587546138/668536324965531648) since it supports a higher resolution than a gif #filesize 🙂 

**spawning from**
![Screen Shot 2020-01-19 at 20 21 47](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/72686906-583ecd80-3af9-11ea-89b7-89bdb24ec0b1.png)

**changable to**
![Screen Shot 2020-01-19 at 20 22 12](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/72686910-655bbc80-3af9-11ea-8074-6e7b15cfe256.png)

**unpowered/unavailable**
![Screen Shot 2020-01-19 at 20 22 35](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/72686918-7c9aaa00-3af9-11ea-8e42-ccf80a006219.png)

> _spawning from_ has a higher visual priority than _unpowered/unavailable_

title: [drones] miner drone dropoff
author: Quezler
body:
> proof of concept, code is not all that serious, this is to kickstart the topic :)

instead of placing the miner drones in the far edges of the map to get free minerals until the end of time, changes them so you actually have to take the items out of them one way or another.

its been discussed a few times to have a dedicated drop off point, but it would probably make most sense to make them drop off at their spawnpoint or cointainers right next to it.

this probably won't go well for drones that require items to spawn since it will unload.

but this would allow for some more precise mining drone usage, since you can get the right amount of copper/lead from anywhere in the map, instead of finding a patch or unloading it from the core 10 miles away.

![Screen Shot 2020-01-06 at 12 33 12](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/71815795-e7230300-3080-11ea-9b0b-32e997421d2a.png)

🥔

title: [sandbox] ability to switch team
author: Quezler
body:
> proof of concept, ui is dirty, code could probably need some work, etc, etc

While testing out the plastanium conveyors on my test server the other day (well, actually today) the thought occurred to me that i could merge my other concepts in there as well (e.g. the tractor beam), but that would only be fun to play with if players could switch between teams.

This is currently only possible if the mode is set to editor, but it would make sense to allow this for sandbox mode (though not by default) as well.

But to prevent abuse its possible to allow only admins to switch teams (in this initial draft)

Not all quadrillion team colors are supported, just the basis 6.

![Screen Shot 2020-01-05 at 15 09 49](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/71781335-d6fe1b80-2fcd-11ea-8d12-71ac1ed82274.png)
![Screen Shot 2020-01-05 at 15 11 44](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/71781336-d8c7df00-2fcd-11ea-955f-b7c0c21c09f5.png)

title: Estimate and display conveyor resource flow
author: mode89
body:
Motivation

Knowing an approximate amount of resources, traveled through a conveyor block, may give an insight on how many upstream consumer blocks need to be built to exploit the whole flow capacity. Also it may tell, whether the conveyor is going to be clogged, if not enough consumers were built.

The flow per each item is being shown in the PlacementFragment, when the mouse hovers above a conveyor block:
![video](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6650803/71644007-5654cc00-2cfc-11ea-8d5b-26e4b2d10e78.gif)


Should it be optional for each block? For example, by having a block configuration UI, that turns on/off the function. This may save some CPU time and memory.

title: Set primitive wrapping to false for scripts
author: analog-hors
body: Rhino usually converts Java primitives to their JS equivalents. However, Rhino actually converts their boxed equivalents (`Boolean` for `boolean`, `Integer` for `int`, etc.) into `JavaObject`s. These `JavaObject`s aren't allowed in `ClassAccess.java`, which is another thing. For now, this PR sets primitive wrapping to false, which converts their boxed values into the primitive equivalents, so that `Boolean` gets converted to a JS `boolean` and is usable.

title: Display cumulative production speed of multiple blocks
author: mode89
body:
Hi,

I would like to propose a new feature. I think, it might come in handy to have a display showing the current production speed of multiple blocks. For example, one might use it for estimating the exact number of the upstream consuming blocks that need to be built.

Here is how it works:
* Press CTRL
* Drag the mouse to select the blocks of interest with the bounding box
* A window pops up in the bottom left corner, showing the cumulative production speed per resource.
* To discard selection, press CTRL again

![video](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6650803/71599559-4d41ee80-2b86-11ea-8f64-74469d3aaa6c.gif)

I've made this pull request as a draft implementation. I'm not sure, whether this feature fits your vision of the game. I would like to hear your comments.

title: [conveyor] plastanium
author: Quezler
body:
> prototype, posting in this state since people seem genuinely interested, so open sourcing it :)

Adds a `plastanium` conveyor with a high(er) throughput than its counterparts, items on it get transported by roomba-like `crater`s. 
(for more info check the discord's `#development` around/before the time of posting this pull)

- code: unstable, messy, plenty of bugs, hacky & edge cases
- sprite: cute as hell
- balanced: barely
- foo: bar

(i have tried higher throughput conveyors before but i ran into the conveyor code wall, and by random luck the train thingy i made recently sparked the idea of moving items on conveyors via entities, bypassing said code entirely, though this is arguably quite heavy because of the increased entity count, while it lacks tons of features, its a nice draft to showcase & gather feedback)

Some graphics of how it looks: (note that it has no power/item cost for each crater)

![Screen Shot 2019-12-27 at 20 47 02 1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/71530433-118af880-28ea-11ea-8a36-2d362e24eb14.png)
![Screen Shot 2019-12-27 at 20 47 09](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/71530436-12238f00-28ea-11ea-9613-fe5dd19b3055.png)
![Dec-27-2019 20-53-09](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/71530609-eb198d00-28ea-11ea-8892-987650908c15.gif)

> _comming soon to ~~stores~~ conveyors near you!_ (well, if anuke likes it that is 🙃)

title: [power] small armored node
author: Quezler
body:
> prototype

**backstory**
Most players would find it rather annoying if an air unit breaks through the defences of a large base which in turn dissect all small power nodes, while the large power node has quite a lot more health (which i only found out halfway through this commit 😳), this powernode is aimed to securely deliver power over long distances without to much worry in regards to in defence, and as a slight bonus it somewhat acts insulated since it can only connect in straight lines, which may or may not prevent some accidental connections.

**caveats**
- currently uses duplicate code
- two power connections in the same direction are possible, resulting in loss of a potential side
- should probably use a node/block property instead of a specific block check
- not sure if the white/glass makes the texture to detailed or not
- uncertain as to how useful this block will be in practice
- probably more 

![Screen Shot 2019-12-21 at 08 04 19](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/71304589-4a4a3f80-23c9-11ea-9e6b-a8774454ae5b.png)
![Screen Shot 2019-12-21 at 08 04 01](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/71304592-4d453000-23c9-11ea-8795-384d22b2bb94.png)

title: [server] uuid security level
author: Quezler
body:
> technical draft (not backwards compatible with 101.*, merge when 102 is around the corner)

This pull adds a security level to go along with the uuid. (inspired by teamspeak)

To increase your security level you need to sacrifice some computing power to compute the next level, which duration grows pretty much exponentially.
(1-4 are relatively fast but 5+ will take a while)

Main purpose is to obstruct those using uuid changers, since you will need to regenerate the security level for each, which can take a considerable amount of time depending on the security level of the server you want to join.

Of course mobile users will have a harder time generating their uuid than powerful desktop users, but there's nothing i can really change about that.

Also malicious users could leave security level generators running 24/7 or rent large computing power/etc, so it might just get in the way a bit of normal users. (though normal users would only have to generate their desired security level once, which can be done with the device left afk or over multiple attempts, the progress is saved)

The technical implementation is currently one big mess:
- uses outside packages
- hijacks the mod list since i could not get the serializer to add a new field
- probably horrible from a cryptographic standpoint, but i'm not a cryptographer
- not sure how backwards compatible propper packet implementations for it will be
- currently settable for steam/local servers
- etc
- (oh and technically a server you're connecting to can steal your uuid & security level, but that "changes nothing", though it should probably use public/private key pairs alltogether)

![Screen Shot 2019-12-20 at 13 59 21](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/71256426-0146ac80-2331-11ea-807b-3ef8ede2a513.png)
![Screen Shot 2019-12-20 at 13 59 29](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/71256428-0146ac80-2331-11ea-84b6-098f91785c09.png)
![Screen Shot 2019-12-20 at 13 59 39](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/71256429-01df4300-2331-11ea-8421-d3ab273ead58.png)

🥔

title: Handle missing locale keys for link descriptions
author: TsjipTsjip
body:
This change prevents the game from crashing when a locale key is missing for a link description listed in the "About" tab. Previously this used `I18NBundle.getNotNull()`, which would kill the process when it finds a given key isn't present. It now uses `I18NBundle.getOrNull()` which will return null values if a key is missing.
Returned null values are handled by listing the keys in a new ArrayList<String> , I may have violated the contribution guidelines here but I am unsure. When the "About" tab is clicked for the first time, an in-game error message is displayed with all the keys that are missing. After dismissing this message, the game just continues as is.

These changes add the following new locale keys: `missinglocale`, `missinglocale.single`. These can be used for displaying missing locale keys elsewhere in the project, however they only serve a purpose in the about tab in this pull request. If these keys are not present, the used text will default to `Missing locale key(s):`.

This is a whole lot for such a minor thing, but this is one of my first contributions to the project and I didn't really know how the project works. I now know much more of this and am still eager to learn.

title: Surge Capacitor (higher tier battery)
author: Arkanic
body:
![Screenshot (16)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50847107/70582131-4f1b3080-1c1e-11ea-9e45-da6aca54f3bb.png)

effectively just a giant battery.
uses high amounts (100) surge to construct, as to make sure that only higher level players/teams construct them & to discourage spamming them. can hold 300k :eyes: power.

I was discussing an idea about making the battery take consumables in return for extra storage space, or make it require cooling, but in the end i felt just making it overly expensive would deter people from creating vast swathes of them.

Ironically, the main purpose of the surge conductor is to hopefully reduce the size of the "battery fields" that people create in order to keep their power stored (like below).
![Screenshot (18)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50847107/70582777-7c68de00-1c20-11ea-8866-05cd04f7b2c0.png)



might need a nerf though

title: 💰Upgrade bannedblocks to allowance
author: Quezler
body:
Whereas banned blocks can either be set to completely allow or block a block, allowance will allow a limit/cap to be set.

This change is backwards compatible for map files, since it automatically imports banned blocks. (though its not backwards compatible with older clients, they will need to upgrade to use it)

The name for it is subject to debate, i've tried a few but none sounded fitting enough:
- `limit` sounds to broad
- `max` of what?
- `quota` sounds like a goal to reach
- `manymore` lorem ipsum

Current caveats:
- players can 'cheat the system' by placing many blocks in their building state, since the flag only gets applied once the building is fully constructed, i'll look into fixing that if this pull gets enough traction.

Oh and the placement of where the allowance shows is up for debate as well, it might be a bit weird for it to show up as a building material for it, but its the least out of place looking location i could have come up with.

![Screen Shot 2019-12-04 at 11 39 16](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/70136180-cf282000-168b-11ea-9446-f10b58fc7661.png)

title: Editor: protect blocks from being changed by players (e.g. item sources)
author: Quezler
body:
![Dec-01-2019 19-19-00](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/69918309-b0017680-1470-11ea-8870-4ee3be4c76bc.gif)
[HD](https://discordapp.com/channels/391020510269669376/393111111853146112/650766369876475935)

This is just a suggestion flavored pull, it adds 3 new block restrictions:

- `unconfigurable`: config of the block can't be changed (e.g. lock output of item sources)
- `unremovable`: block cannot be deconstructed by its team (e.g. griefing item sources or having pregenerated parts of a factory in the map)
- `unkillable`: cannot take fatal damage (maybe for asthetics or something, unkillable scap walls)

(multiblock tiles can have several under them, but in the case of a single tile block i added a `immortal` one that inherits all 3)

original idea was just to make itemsources unconfigurable, but the next best thing griefers might do is remove it, and if they cannot do that they will just try to blow it up, so the bottom two are just out of necessity.

needless to say the code is messy and stuff happens where it should not happen, but its just enough to get this pull reasonably stable as a proof of concept.

caveats:
- if the unkillable is under a core, obviously that team cannot die
- during refractor lots of `set` got changed to `add`, to lazy to fix it for this prototype
- if an unconfigurable tile dies somehow, and something new gets build ontop of it, the new block is also unconfigurable
- probably more

title: 🎇 Observer mech
author: Quezler
body:
![Screen Shot 2019-11-28 at 19 43 49](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/69827716-d88f3380-1218-11ea-9b90-64f97ec03a68.png)

This is just a rough proof of concept, not intended to be merged straight away, yadayadayada, etc.

It adds a mech that (theoretically) can only observe, it can't: (well, shouldn't be able to)

- shoot
- build
- destroy
- take
- mine
- configure
- targeted
- etc

(it can however see block contents, block configurations, etc) (and can still use mech pads!)

The uses i had in mind:
- a mech to scout enemy bases on attack maps, since it won't be targeted, so you can have a peaceful look around.
- events on custom (modded/plugined) servers, where dead players or guests can still observe the game after they died or something, or perhaps a state to put new players in so they can be shown around without being able to grief anything.

(well now that i typed that out it sounds boring and unusable, but i'll continue typing nontheless to see where it can lead)

In a nutshell this is a highly situational mech, but the circumstances under which its useful do not yet exist, but its existence will catalyst the creation of the uses a mech like this provides.

Texture is based on parts of all flying ships, though i picked surge as a color to showcase its special status as compared to: `orange (attack) / blue (ambush) / green (support)`

Reused my `core-seed` texture for its (hidden) pad.

![Nov-28-2019 19-45-31](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/69827722-df1dab00-1218-11ea-8888-0f2b7c4d4aff.gif)

(this pull has plenty of bugs & things overlooked, and just a bit unpolished in how it does things)

🥔

title: Conservative Generators
author: thomas-spriggs
body:
Implementation of https://github.com/Anuken/Mindustry/issues/804

When the power needed plus the power put into batteries is less than the
total generation capacity, conservative generators will conserve a
portion of their input items proportional to the percentage of optional
conservative power generation, which is unused. The conservation is
carried out based on extending the amount of time until the generators
will consume an additional item of fuel. So for example if the power
needed is 50% of the production capacity which is entirely conservative
then the generators will take 2x as long between consuming items of
fuel.

title: Adding the feature to switch doors using a logic controller
author: Remint32
body:
- [x] _Compiled and tested_

- 1) the **Player** and the **controller** can _equal_ access to the door switch.
- 2) the controller has the same _click delay_ as the player.
- 3) if controller reversed the signal _on positive_ - the door will is **open**, if reversed _on empty_ the door **closes**.
- 4) the Controller also switches the door provided that its signal has _changed_ (if the controller signal does not change and the player switches the door, then the **3** point is _ignored_ until the controller signal changes)
- 5) If there is a situation that the door did **not have time to switch** because of the delay and the signal **does not comply** with the rule of paragraph **3** **_AND_** the player does not switch the door _manually_, the door will change its state to the correct one after the delay.

[**> A short video showing the principle of operation <** (YouTube)](https://youtu.be/V7WosSEv1lw)

title: Calculate powerbalance before batteries interfere
author: Quezler
body:
This allows the power node(s) to display the amount of power being used while there is still charge in the batteries.

Its useful to be able to see at what rate batteries are draining and not just by looking at the `K` bar for a while to try to notice a change.

And it is especially useful with diodes, when charging your main network its not uncommon to see `+0/s` basically everywhere, giving a poor indication of the actual usage of the network.

To my knowledge this chance is fully (backwards)compatible and is purely visual.

It should make the diodes slightly less horrible than they are in their current state. 🙂

title: [anti-air] tractor beam 🦈
author: Quezler
body:
> You know, I have one simple request. And that is to have sharks with frickin' laser beams attached to their heads! Now evidently my cycloptic colleague informs me that that cannot be done. Ah, would you remind me what I pay you people for, honestly? Throw me a bone here! What do we have?

Many players are occasionally requesting a early/mid game electric anti air turret (which admittedly would be mildly op)

This commit on the other hand adds an electric anti air tractor beam, which can be used to reel in enemy air units to your turrets instead of having to wall your base off completely. 

Having air units dragged in allows anti air turrets with less range to be more useful in late games, as well as not having to anti-air every nook and cranny of your base, but just a few _venus fly traps_ (tractor beam + turret(s) group) throughout your base.

The tractor beam uses a lot of power (when active) and in return adds velocity to the closest enemy air unit to drag them in, though its not high enough to be inescapable.

Effects stack.

Please observe the following example, with the laser set to friendly fire my glaive:
![Nov-17-2019 21-00-47](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/69013176-9266e400-097d-11ea-9236-4fc1228bb988.gif)

known (potential) issues:
- when unit is right above the tractor beam the light flickers 
- not sure if boss/bigger units are dragged in proportionally to their size & mass
- probably more

title: Clean up text capitalization, misc UI
author: joshuaptfan
body:
## Cleaned Up
* Made capitalization consistently Title Case for labels in settings and editor
* Corrected capitalization of the word "GitHub" in all localizations
* Highlighted "[WASD]" in tutorial for consistency with other text involving inputs in tutorial
* Removed extra space in mobile tutorial
* Added 10 second step to save interval slider in game settings
  * This is currently the only settings slider without steps
* Moved "Dash" binding to under "Follow Mouse" in control settings to group movement controls together
* Put Power Infinite before Power Void in sandbox for consistency with Item Source/Item Void order
* Arranged inputs in logical tiered order in alloy smelter's info (copper, lead, titanium, silicon)
  * Seriously, I always have trouble remembering what to feed alloy smelters because info has them in such a random order (see [chunking (psychology)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chunking_(psychology)))

title: Core: seed
author: Quezler
body:
![Screen Shot 2019-11-14 at 12 07 35](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/68852096-822ddb00-06d7-11ea-9046-d7c64d54761e.png)
![Screen Shot 2019-11-14 at 15 39 12](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/68866577-f034cb00-06f4-11ea-9806-eae320cea399.png)


a buildable core block:

- cannot interact with tiles (`conveyors/unloaders/vaults/etc`)
- enemies do not go after this block (aka: not beeline to this core)
- will not count towards alive cores (implementation in pull inadequate)

intended usage:

- allows players to drop off or take from the core manually without being near an actual core (or just see the total available building resources)
- mining drones will drop off here as well, keeping the airspace around the real core(s) free
- can be used as an early warning system if a defence is breached, since it flashes the hud when damaged (depends on https://github.com/Anuken/Mindustry/pull/1058)

related:
- https://feathub.com/Anuken/Mindustry/+207
- https://feathub.com/Anuken/Mindustry/+30
- https://github.com/Anuken/Mindustry/pull/955

todo:

maybe refractor it away from `coreblock` so the enemy units / gameover logic / etc would not need an additional check, preventing player respawns, etc, though still keeping the properties mentioned above ^ (and probably turret target priority or something so increase the chance of it being hit)

trivia:

- originally planned to call it `core-fragment`, but since i used the bush as a base texture (round to signify that it should not connect to other blocks) `core-seed` sounded more appropriate  

some screenshots illustrating the above:

![Screen Shot 2019-11-14 at 12 26 05](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/68853391-2f095780-06da-11ea-91ac-c752bfca5330.png)
![Screen Shot 2019-11-14 at 12 26 44](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/68853392-2f095780-06da-11ea-8903-102d181fc9b1.png)
![Screen Shot 2019-11-14 at 12 27 34](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/68853394-2fa1ee00-06da-11ea-91ba-95d270c2bbb6.png)

title: Colorize powernodes based on network status instead of its powerlines
author: Quezler
body:
https://feathub.com/Anuken/Mindustry/+231

This pull is a draft for showing the status of the power graph visually on each node instead of their web of connections.

- idle/unconnected/texture/etc: `default/null`
- making more power than consuming: `green`
- using power from batteries: `orange`
- using more power than is being produced: `red`

Colors obviously need some work, way to bright, and the surge tower looks strange now.
(and needless to say `red` could be anywhere from no power available to almost all power available, it currently does not majestically fade between colors based on the exact satisfaction)

The above feathub link suggested leds, but instead of additional block(s) it would be more logical to visually modify the power nodes.

These changes should communicate the status of the power network more cleanly to the players:

- `green` all is fine
- `orange` check on power production
- `red` make more power available

Again, this is a technical proof of concept / draft / yadayada, its quality at this stage is nowhere near mergable, code quality is mediocre at best and the graphics look awful, this is just to get the ball rolling.

![Nov-13-2019 11-44-24](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/68756996-78d73c80-060b-11ea-9380-1de0bfe587ab.gif)

title: Keep items on conveyor when upgrading
author: Quezler
body:
https://feathub.com/Anuken/Mindustry/+234
https://feathub.com/Anuken/Mindustry/+206

This is a just technical proof of concept, do not take this way to serious.

It carries over conveyor contents when the previous and next building block are both conveyors.

This is useful when lets say upgrading an incoming belt of titanium heading into your core without slowing your progress since you're killing the required titanium needed for upgrading while you're upgrading.

But it also has a flip side, often when you want to get rid of items on a conveyor (e.g. `sand/coal/scrap` mixed in) its common practice to just up/down grade the conveyor to get rid of those items, this pull would prevent that, hence the draft / technical proof of concept.

A different approach would be to send all the items (that are capable of entering the core) directly to the core when destroying a conveyor/block containing those items, similar to the "dropping of" of a player / mining drone inventory.

But since that might feel like teleportation somewhat it would maybe make sense to grab the items from the belt and put them into the inventory of the player, but that leaves edge cases for when multiple items are on the belt, since units can only carry one (afaik), and of course the carry limit comes into play.

I'd love to collect some thoughts on this topic 📥 

![Nov-12-2019 11-24-11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/68663459-fc772780-053e-11ea-91b4-c2cbc1cb4c30.gif)

title: Conveyor upgrade assist
author: Quezler
body:
Haha, just noticed, title probably fooled you. 🃏 

Anyways, this (very rough draft pull with ugly code) adds upgrading capabilities to builder drones.

Here is a before and after:
![Screen Shot 2019-11-06 at 12 34 29](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/68295175-196cb000-0092-11ea-9d8c-8331794feaac.png)
![Screen Shot 2019-11-06 at 12 35 09](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/68295179-1a9ddd00-0092-11ea-8d26-91f102c7af5c.png)

Basically what this does is making idle builder drones go around and upgrading upgradable blocks to their next tier. (in steps)

`conduit > pulse conduit`
`conveyor > titanium > armored` (only upgrades to armored if it won't interfere with sides)
`copper wall > titanium > thorium > surge` (plastanium and phase intentionally kept out)

This (currently) only upgrades if the before & after blocks are of the same size, it does not go around upgrading 2x2 single walls to large ones nor 3x3 solar panels to 1 big one, ima let that up to the discussion of this pr.

Mildly related to [feathub](https://feathub.com/Anuken/Mindustry/+169)

title: Fix key hints to display friendly names instead of internal names
author: joshuaptfan
body:
`Core.keybinds.get(Binding).key.name()` gives the [enum name](https://github.com/Anuken/Arc/blob/master/arc-core/src/io/anuke/arc/input/KeyCode.java) instead of the user-friendly name. This becomes a problem when the player binds controls to keys like "L-Shift", "[", "1", etc. which will display as "SHIFT_LEFT", "LEFT_BRACKET", "NUM_1", etc.

Using `toString()` instead fixes it, but I'm not sure if this is the correct fix, as [KeybindDialog.java](https://github.com/Anuken/Arc/blob/master/arc-core/src/io/anuke/arc/scene/ui/KeybindDialog.java) does it differently.

author: Quezler
body:
> The unholy offspring of [lightning](https://feathub.com/Anuken/Mindustry/+130) and [death](https://feathub.com/Anuken/Mindustry/+33) itself. Never engage this ~dragon~ conduit. Your only chance: Hide and pray it does not ~find you~ leak. (edit: and apparently [this](https://feathub.com/Anuken/Mindustry/+124) one as well)

This pull adds an conduit with the following properties:
- armored, duh.
- leaks significantly slower.
- same connection behavior as its conveyor counterpart.

![Screen Shot 2019-11-05 at 15 00 19](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/68214049-02b85180-ffdd-11e9-84f9-6636a78ac46a.png)
named it `plated-conduit` instead of `armored-conduit` since the `phase-conduit` isn't named `titanium-conduit`, thus opposing the conveyor naming logic*

title: Power productivity & Drone pad standby
author: Quezler
body:
This pull request introduces two chances:

- power productivity, consumers can now (unlike before) increase/decrease their power realtime.
- drone pad standby, consumes no power while not in use.

Since drones are autonomous once launched it would not make sense to lower their move/mine/attack speed based on the condition their pad is in, and the pad is literally & visually not doing anything while the drones are maxed, so it would make sense for them to use no power during.

Possible balance changes:

- increase base power usage of all drone pads, to compensate the long run.
- make standby drone pads use a fraction of the power while on standby.

This pull is mainly to prevent the constant (dis)connecting of (mainly miner) drones to save a few grains of power, which seems like a chore to have to babysit them until they grow up. (or die)

edit: found a related [feathub](https://feathub.com/Anuken/Mindustry/+117) entry.

title: 🐬 Factorio flavoured powerlines
author: Quezler
body:
**annoyance**
When trying to move & place powerpoles over long distances it often turns out roughly like this, inefficient and duplicate nodes:
![Screen Shot 2019-11-05 at 08 29 58](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/68187276-90c51580-ffa6-11e9-96c5-069db6547ca2.png)

**proposed**
This draft overrides drag-placing powernodes (since who needs those back to back anyways?) by not placing those middlemen.
By default it places them in a straight line, but they will use the convejor pathfinding when said key is held down.
It will not take existing powernodes on the map into account, thus the lines may interconnect in a strange way, though the beginning and end are guaranteed still connect one way or another.
![Nov-05-2019 08-32-33](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/68187494-1943b600-ffa7-11e9-89a7-3618f4437a4a.gif)

**caveats**
- doesn't check if a large powerpole can fit in a found 1x1 tile
- doesn't suggest a new location if the found one is entirely obstructed
- doesn't pathfind the shortest route over the terain
- probably more, but hey, its a draft :)

title: Add max connections stat to power nodes
author: joshuaptfan
body:
Exposes the `maxNodes` stat of power nodes to the player as "Max Connections". I think this is useful info for players, especially the surge tower's 2 connection maximum. Even though the other power nodes have a lot of connections available, it's still easy to go over the limit with 1x1 blocks like arc turrets, batteries, solar panels, etc.

## Added
* PowerNode.java: 1 new stat
* BlockStat.java: 1 new stat type
* Related untranslated localization text

title: Implement number and directional category/block selection hotkeys
author: joshuaptfan
body:
This PR implements [this hotkeys suggestion](https://www.reddit.com/r/Mindustry/comments/dlmklh/hotkeys_suggestions_for_building/).

When I had the idea for this suggestion, I didn't know that Mindustry already had hotkeys at the time (that were [removed soon after](https://github.com/Anuken/Mindustry/commit/2e0e3512283afa923a2b5fb4a09a3b4977f5f5f0)). The success or failure of this new hotkey system depends on making it discoverable to players via hints/tutorial.

## Added
* 16 new key bindings (10 numbers, 2 category prev/next, 4 directions)
* Dynamically generated hotkey combo hint (e.g. "Conveyor Key: [3,1]") in each recipe's hover info
* Hotkey tutorial in tutorial mission
* 2 new desktop-only settings (block selection timeout, show block select keys)
* PlacementFragment.java method:
  * `Block getSelectedBlock(Category)`
* Category.java public methods:
  * `Category prev()`
  * `Category next()`

## Modified
* Blocks.java: Moved sandbox blocks to end of each category so hotkey muscle memory will carry over to sandbox
* PlacementFragment.java method:
  * `Array<Block> getByCategory(Category)`

## Cleaned Up
* Moved "Dash" binding to under "Move X/Y" in settings
* Capitalized "X"/"Y" in "Move X/Y" for consistency with "Flip Schematic X/Y"
* Made "# seconds" lowercase for "save interval"
* Added 10 second step to "save interval" slider

title: 🔩 Add (plastanium) diode
author: Quezler
body:
A possible implementation for [this suggestion](https://feathub.com/Anuken/Mindustry/+20) by @constatinus (and many others)

**functionality**
This pull adds an insulated diode block, that (currently) forwards power (50% of the difference) from one battery to another if the power within `from` is greater than the `to` battery, a large battery can fully fill both small and large batteries, but small batteries will only fill large batteries to `4k`.

**example 1**
Below is an example of an `impact reactor` that will not shut down if the "outside network"'s power turns negative, since the battery inside the walls will only store/transmit "excess" energy, thus it will always have just enough power to stay running, but it will export all that it won't need.

![Screen Shot 2019-10-31 at 12 34 50](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/67944002-aec3fc00-fbdb-11e9-92e8-4ca8d264160c.png)

**example 2**
Below is an example of high energy usage machines/parts of your base that you would only want to run if there is enough spare power for it.
![Screen Shot 2019-10-31 at 13 16 54](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/67946112-db2e4700-fbe0-11e9-93fe-86aacaeaa0f1.png)


**thoughts**
- i went with the `plastanium` border color to signify its insulated property, which fits nice with the existing power insulation walls, to signify & prevent accidental connections through a possibly one wide gap.
- base texture was a solar panel, which is overlayn by what most would consider a diode icon.
- recipe is a mix between solar panels and plastanium walls, since its both electric but also insulates.
- not sure if i used `entity.sleep()` correctly here, it would make some sense to not constantly check for batteries until a proximity update has been found.
- my intention is to add a functionality to "inject" into the other power graph somehow, thoughts on that are pending.
- it extends `Block` since that was the first place i found that had rotation support, though it should probably be moved to a power block type.
- went with interacting between batteries since i wasn't sure if/how a block could support being part of two graphs, and battery blocks happen to store power, so this simple thing just facilitates moving power from one battery to another, not caring which graph any is connected to.

🥔

title: 🗜 Pressure conduit
author: Quezler
body:
![Screen Shot 2019-10-30 at 13 09 27](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/67857340-d4d39880-fb16-11e9-8775-ebbf2b3b7662.png)
When transporting liquids over long distances the `pressure/fullness/quantity/etc` tends to suffer, this is my attempt to add a conduit that can output at a slightly higher  `〃` than its input side.

While it technically may not change a lot (a high to low flow won't ruin or blow up stuff) it would be visually pleasing to be able to get a large quantity of liquids to a location and pressurize it somehow (that does not involve filling the entire path to 100% capacity) to get that sweet sweet fluid glow going.

I had originally considered that it would need power (trivia at bottom), i instead went for a high tech material, surge alloy in this case, to be the explanation for why it works without power, open to suggestions regarding this. 

The below example setup is a bit crude, but it illustrates how that over longer distances chained `pressure conduits` the "bonus" adds up, and it can "suck" lower `〃` conduits dry, one could view it as a `reverse overflow gate`, since it can pressurize specific parts of a pipe network first.

(though they don't need to be chained `back to back`, as long as they are somewhere in a flow path their bonuses add up, the pressure they output can be seen as a "checkpoint")

![Oct-30-2019 13-07-56](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/67857335-d1401180-fb16-11e9-95e1-981bea2a5882.gif)

(my initial attempts consisted of a `liquid tank / machine` hybrid with compression animations and what not, but that hit a few roadblocks along the way, so i tried a new conduit type instead 😗)

title: 🌡 Silicon furnace
author: Quezler
body: Silicon setups don't scale very well once you need one or more blue belts of titanium 😗 (and a plethora of other reasons) This (obviously a draft) pull request adds a `multi-press` equivalent for the silicon smelter 😇 But instead of requiring water it uses heat from its environment: - source 1: magma tiles, up to roughly 2/3rd efficiency - source 2: overheating thorium reactor, up to 3/3 efficiency (the 2 sources are summed together for the final heat, but the reactor won't heat if its heat is less than or equal to what the magma tiles already provide) Reasoning behind is that it would be to easy otherwise, these requirements demand some more planing/thought/placement 🔬 - source 1: magma tiles are often sparse, and a 3x3 square of the _good_ ones tend to be rare, do note that the machine also works on less than perfect tiles, as long as at least something gives heat. - source 2: having to create a controlled environment that slowly feeds thorium (or limits coolant) to get the reactor to overheat anywhere from 0 to 100% So the challenge this block provides is that you'd need to setup an overheating setup, the closer to annihilation the faster the machine becomes, so high risk high reward **or** if you're lucky the map will provide some heat 🏅 Or of course use the normal ones as a fallback, but lose space in comparison, this would be neat in tight maps 🐁 Oh and the `i/o` is the same as the smaller one, the batches are just larger, since this is just intended to safe space, but the subject is open for balancing ⚖️ Demo of several setups, note that i had disabled thorium reactor explosions locally, 100% efficiency is not exactly safe, but even the lesser speeds (and even more so with phase'd overdrivers) should be sufficient 🤔 ![Oct-28-2019 11-39-34](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/67672447-3f020700-f978-11e9-8da8-21b7b55e488a.gif) [sprite source](https://github.com/Anuken/Mindustry/files/3778332/gimp-silicon-furnace.xcf.zip) 🖌[gimp](https://www.gimp.org/)

When getting the value of PowerGraph, a #iterator error occurred if it did not match the tick on the server.


title: 🚧 Add insulator wall
author: Quezler
body:
**problem**

(especially when) playing on servers you might want to keep certain power grids(/graphs) separate from one another for a multitude of reasons:

- a mass driver chain with its own power supply
- ditto for phase conveyors
- keeping the production & defense grids separate
- have self sufficient thorium & titanium mines for a power plant that powers the rest
- preventing vital systems going down by accidentally connecting them to other grids
- etc

on single player its still "somewhat easy" to oversee, but on multiplayer not everyone shares your grey matter so they wouldn't be fully aware of grid intentions unless e.g. message boards are placed everywhere.

**brainstorms**

on my road to a solution i stumbled upon several ideas:

- a "sorter" block that could be connected to a grid that colorized their wires for a visual difference, but then what if one or more graphs get forcibly merged via e.g. a solar panel placed between them? would the colors somehow merge? how would the gui look to set colors? etc? 

- a setting on the powerpoles somehow that prevented all automatic connections, but that shares the same issues as the above, moreover: how would players on a server find out where the power sorting blocks and/or configurable powerpoles are located? would be confusing if for some visually unknown reason a wire would not (want to) connect.

- a wall block that blocks "all" wires from going over, but then it would be weird to have awkwardly shaped gaps in the wall just for wires to pass through, and you'd also have to have logic in place that would check for all wires above a wall once placed, overall a technical nightmare.

- so eventually i've settled for a wall that simply blocks automatic connections from going over them, players can still connect them manually, this allows for a subsystem to be completely walled without gaps, and power is also easy to extract, and as a bonus it communicates to other players that the separate grid is intentional, instead of others mistaking it for a bug and "fixing" it by proudly connecting it to the grid and calling it a day.

**considerations**

- a 1x1 insulator block would be more than enough, the 2x2 insulator would probably not be used (a lot), but walls come in even numbers so i've added it for that reason.
- texture is the titanium wall saturated down to greyscale. (hence why its declaration in the files is right below titanium)
- i've tried to mimic the recent commits where new blocks got added, not sure if this is the exact method you would have used, but thats why its called a prototype :)
- as of writing this i noticed that it only applies to placed power poles, placing other things would still cause the powerpoles from "inside" the wall the connect over them to said machinery, will probably send a commit to solve that soon.
- for the costs i went with silicon and glass, since those are common things to use in (high voltage) insulators, this commit also includes a tech tree entry where i've placed them behind the kiln, since it felt more fitting there than in the wall section, but feel free to change that.

**visuals**

![Screen Shot 2019-10-19 at 13 09 33](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/67143982-c01f1700-f271-11e9-847b-cbee9e0d5cd1.png)
(static)

![Untitled](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179271/67144078-f4df9e00-f272-11e9-9394-28c9b2761821.gif)
(phase conveyors with their own power supply)

title: inverse match sorter
author: azureblue
body:
I've added the ability for Sorter to split items to sides that do **not match** with the selected item. This feature was mentioned in the suggestions/ideas, and this is often desired to be able to get specific item from the conveyor.

It can be configured by selecting one of two buttons below the items table when the Sorter is clicked and whether it set up to inverse match it's also reflected as reddish (signalling that it blocks/prevent highlighted item to move forward) bar near the top.

I'm not sure if that interface is the best possible and I'm not very attached to the icons I've made :). The size of the icons is the same as in the Command Center. Anyway, It's just a draft.

Tell me what you think guys.

![Peek 2019-10-09 19-222](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4013688/66507820-31bbd000-ead0-11e9-8da0-da6ac01ec11e.gif)

And with icons centered:
![Przechwycenie obrazu ekranu_2019-10-09_19-34-09](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4013688/66508191-dd652000-ead0-11e9-9a04-d5317282054f.png)
