title: Power Lasers Transparency
author: azureblue
body:
Sometimes power lasers look too bright and cover too much area (especially when they are clustered) and I've been missing a functionality that would allow to change that. So I implemented it.

It required some changes in block rendering (and scheduling blocks to render) code so that each visible laser is rendered **only once**. This particular change optimizes draws and increases FPS.

The opacity can by change in the Settings->Graphics->Power Laser Opacity.

I'v also slightly reduced lasers width.

How it looks like with different transparency values:
![lasers-transparency](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4013688/66262387-c5df1c00-e7de-11e9-8399-7233e306c32e.gif)

title: Hybrid grid hotkey mode.
author: eldstal
body:
Use number keys to select a building category, then the 4x4 grid of keys (1234 through zxcv) to select a recipe from that category.

No modifier keys needed, makes it easier to play with a keyboard.

title: [WIP]Translate steam metadata in french

body:
Hi,

I translated Steam description and achievements to french.

It's almost complete :smile: 

I would appreciate your input on the following achievements.
For each I made some suggestions with comments.

| _**Shapeshifter**_  |  |
| --- | --- |
| **Métamorphe** | _Literal translation but not very used in french and has an organic connotation (werewolves are shapeshifter but not really mech)_ | 
| **Transformer** | _Famous transforming mechs and used as is in french (but isn't it a trademark :sweat_smile:)_ | 
|  **Pilote** |   _"Pilot" as you mastered piloting all the mechs and ships (personal suggestion)_ | 

| _**Browser**_ |  |
| --- | --- |
| **Navigateur** | _Literal translation but double meaning of "Navigator/Sailor" in French_ | 
| **Explorateur** | _"Explorer" (personal suggestion)_ | 

| _**Collector**_ |  |
| --- | --- |
| **Collecteur** | _like functional collector_ | 
| **Collectionneur** | _like trading card collector_ | 
| **Percepteur**  | _like tax collector_ | 


Thanks again for this amazing game

title: Vastly improved Estonian translation bundle
author: charliewxyz
body:
**Why was the user interface code edited?**

For `editor.MapResizeDialog`, `$ok` makes the dialog similar to other Cancel/OK dialogs.

For `ui.AboutDialog` and `ui.Links`, I added the possibility to provide custom link titles in localization bundles using the key `link.<link-name>.title`. If no such key is found, the previous implementation is used.

For `dialogs.CustomRulesDialog`, I unified the order of health and damage multiplier options.

For `dialogs.ZoneInfoDialog`, I changed the width of the `< LAUNCH >` button from 150 to 200 as the Estonian translation `< LENDUTÕUS >` got squished into two lines with the old width.

title: Fixes bug which let phase conveyor operate with any non-zero power; now requires full power to work
author: dheld
body:
AnnaLaura reported this bug a few weeks ago.

Instead of making it binary, we could degrade the throughput by scaling the transport by the `satisfaction`, but this is the easiest fix.

I noticed that Phased Conduit has the same problem, but the code looks like it does scale by `satisfaction`.  However, I can't measure any perf difference betwen a barely-powered and fully powered liquid bridge, so I'm not sure how the code works.

title: Minor code cleanup and fail-fast NPE validation for status effects
author: dheld
body: This PR undoes your band-aid for null status effects, but adds earlier validation to help debugging.  Alternatively, when a null effect is requested, we can set it to none instead and dump a stack trace, but then it will be less obvious when something blows up, and we will have to rely on users being diligent and sending traces.

totally did not expect that (expected the ship to move on its own, like in Star Craft, Total Anihilation etc.)

server.kicked.vote = You have been vote-kicked. Goodbye.

but does it mean kicked FROM voting or BY voting or what?)

title: Fixes minimap zoom bug
author: dheld
body: This bug appears to primarily affect desktop users, since mobile allows for full map scrolling during pause.  The number of listeners increased every time the minimap was opened, which would cause each scroll event to get multiplied by the number of listeners.  Clearing the listeners fixes the problem.

title: fixed scrolling with mouse (2)
author: markus-gerber
body:
Hey,

I noticed a little bug, which made it impossible to scroll through some dialogs with the mouse on a desktop machine.

Affected Dialogs:

title: Resources war - new pvp gamemode
author: Natchuz
body:
# Resources war
The general idea of this gamemode is to feed a special block with items, and gain points. Some items are more valuable and collect more points. When the condition is met, a team with the fewest points gets eliminated.

## 2 Submodes
- Regular - The weakest team gets eliminated after a specified time
- Rushgame - The weakest team gets eliminated after someone reaches specified points threshold

## Mechanics
- Remember to protect your Item Eater at all cost. When destroyed, points are also gone.
- Core is immutable, but when an enemy team damages it, they steal points from Eaters.
- Buffs. They appear from time to time and makes specified item 2 times more valuable.
- Lifes. Team may have many chances before final elimination.

## Todo & to discuss
- [x] Item Eater. Any idea of a better name?
- [x] Item Eater. You know, my graphics skills end on drawing stickmen. And texture... Could someone help?
- [x] ~~Tag submode. I thought of this, but I'm not sure if this should be a thing. Like in regular mode, but time resets after the weakest team is changed.~~
- [x] ~~Resources war. Maybe this should be Economic Wars, or sth?~~
- [x] Balancing
- [x] This may collide with my other PR, especially eliminated dialog (I made this before)
- [x] Some strings, and descriptions
- [x] I implemented limited respawns for this mode. We can disable it only for regular pvp mode
- [ ] UI. It's too complex. And this is problem

title: Applied Factory Method Pattern in Mechs.java
author: fenrir94
body:
## Abstract 
Applied Factory Method Pattern in Mechs.java for Single Responsibility Principle, Open Closed Principle, and maintainability.

## 10 Files Changed
1 File modified: `Mechs.java`
9 Files created:  `MechanicFactory.java`,  `alpha.java`, `dart.java`, `delta.java`, `glaive.java`, `javelin.java`, `omega.java`, `tau.java`, `trident.java`

## Details
- Created `mechanic` package in `io.anuke.mindustry.entities` package
- Created `MechanicFactory.java`,  `alpha.java`, `dart.java`, `delta.java`, `glaive.java`, `javelin.java`, `omega.java`, `tau.java`, and `trident.java` in `mechanic` package 
- `alpha.java`, `dart.java`, `delta.java`, `glaive.java`, `javelin.java`, `omega.java`, `tau.java`, and `trident.java` are subclasses of `Mech.java`. These are copies of `Mechs.java`'s original codes.
- Factory method `createMechanic` in `MechaincFactory.java` can create instances of  `Mech.java`'s subclasses by variable `String name` such as `"alpha-mech"` or `"delta-mech"`.

title: Fix call to method with a wrong name (Scope::getMembers() instead of Scope::getSymbols())
author: Paragoumba

title: Decoupling editor/MapEditor from editor/OperationStack
author: fenrir94
body:
## Abstract
Decouple [MapEditor](https://github.com/Anuken/Mindustry/blob/master/core/src/io/anuke/mindustry/editor/MapEditor.java) from [OperationStack](https://github.com/Anuken/Mindustry/blob/master/core/src/io/anuke/mindustry/editor/OperationStack.java). [OperationStack](https://github.com/Anuken/Mindustry/blob/master/core/src/io/anuke/mindustry/editor/OperationStack.java) does not know about the [`MapEditor`](https://github.com/Anuken/Mindustry/blob/master/core/src/io/anuke/mindustry/editor/MapEditor.java) now.

## Changed
- extract [`MapEditor`](https://github.com/Anuken/Mindustry/blob/master/core/src/io/anuke/mindustry/editor/MapEditor.java) from [`editor/OperationStack`](https://github.com/Anuken/Mindustry/blob/master/core/src/io/anuke/mindustry/editor/OperationStack.java)
- [`DrawOperation`](https://github.com/Anuken/Mindustry/blob/master/core/src/io/anuke/mindustry/editor/DrawOperation.java) has [MapEditor](https://github.com/Anuken/Mindustry/blob/master/core/src/io/anuke/mindustry/editor/MapEditor.java) field which is assigned on initialization.

title: Reduce the cyclomatic complexity of render method in MapRenderer.java
author: fenrir94
body: # Method refactoring reason I have checked the cyclomatic complexity of `MapRenderer.java` file through the analysis program which is a plugin of IntelliJ. The result shows the below table. method | ev(G)[1](#f1) | iv(G)[2](#f2) | v(G)[3](#f3) -- | -- | -- | -- draw(float,float,float,float) | **4**| 4 | 5 dispose() | 2 | 4 | 5 resize(int,int) | 1 | 4 | 6 MapRenderer.updateAll() | 1 | 3 | 3 MapRenderer.MapRenderer(MapEditor) | 1 | 1 | 1 **render(int,int)** | 1 | **12** | **13** updatePoint(int,int) | 1 | 1 | 1 -- | -- | -- | -- *Total* | 11 | 29 | 34 *Average* | 1.571428571 | 4.142857143 | 4.857142857 Summarize is looks like the below graph. ![PieChart](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16631264/58383517-e6b68a00-8012-11e9-85f6-209a54b46895.png) As you can see only one `render` method has **almost 40%** of cyclomatic complexity in this file. Therefore, I refactor this method and reduce the cyclomatic complexity. # Changed list Unfortunately, I can't fully understand your code. So, I think that you can think the some of the names are really odd. I ask for your understanding regarding this matter. Following contents are related in essential changes of my pull requests. **1. I packed some formula** - Your code is really compact and reasonable. But some of the formulae was hard to read. So I pack that formula. An example is like below. ```java // BEFORE float offsetX = -(wall.size / 3) * tilesize, offsetY = -(wall.size / 3) * tilesize; // AFTER float offsetSize = -Mathf.floor((float)(wall.size / 3.0)) * tilesize; FloatPoint offset = new FloatPoint(offsetSize, offsetSize); ``` **2. Add some `Point` and `Rectangle` class** - `Point` class separated built-in and nested class `FloatPoint`. Because of the former doesn't handle the float value. So, I added the handle the float value class like the latter. Furthermore, I don't want to interfere with your overall system. As a result, I made the latter with nested class. - `Rectangle` class is related in the region. I checked that `mesh.draw` has `x, y, width, height`. So, I added the appropriate class to make more efficient to map `mesh.draw` parameters. **3. Separate two-part** - I separate the inner 'render' method to two-part(`renderMeshRegion`, `renderTileRegion`). I thought that these changes are necessary. But I don't feel that this naming is true. **With all due respect, please confirm this naming.** # Result After I did this, the metric changes like below. method | ev(G)[1](#f1) | iv(G)[2](#f2) | v(G)[3](#f3) -- | -- | -- | -- dispose() | 2 | 4 | 5 draw(float,float,float,float) | 4 | 4 | 5 drawMesh(...) | 1 | 2 | 2 resize(int,int) | 1 | 4 | 6 updateAll() | 1 | 3 | 3 updatePoint(int,int) | 1 | 1 | 1 **FloatPoint.FloatPoint(float,float)** | 1 | 1 | 1 **getChunkStartPoint(Point)** | 1 | 1 | 1 **getEditorIcon(Block,boolean)** | 1 | 2 | 2 **getMesh(Point)** | 1 | 1 | 1 **getMeshOffset(float)** | 1 | 1 | 1 **getRandomValue(int,int)** | 1 | 1 | 1 **getRegionInstance(String)** | 1 | 1 | 1 **getTile(Point)** | 1 | 1 | 1 **isAirBlock(Block)** | 1 | 1 | 1 **MapRenderer(MapEditor)** | 1 | 1 | 1 **render(int,int)** | 1 | 1 | 1 **renderMeshRegion(...)** | 1 | 5 | 5 **renderTileRegion(...)** | 1 | 6 | 7 -- | -- | -- | -- *Total* | 23 | 41 | 46 *Average* | 1.210526316 | 2.157894737 | 2.421052632 Summarize is looks like the below graph. ![PieChart2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16631264/58384141-52035a80-8019-11e9-9347-13fc295dcb26.png) Unlike before, you can see that the values are evenly distributed. And I expect that my request will have a positive impact on your future changes in the `editor`. *I am looking forward to your positive response.* --- 1: Essential Cyclomatic Complexity 2: Design Complexity 3: Cyclomatic Complexity

title: Update block config every frame
author: polyipseity
body:
---
### Description
Makes config every frame using `Element.update(Runnable)`,
which means when a config of a block is opened,
if somebody else changes the settings of the block,
the change is reflected instantly instead of reopening the config.
### Changes
Buttons are updated every frame.
~~`configurable` is replaced with `isConfigurable(Tile)`.~~
~~`buildTable(Tile, Table)` returns a `boolean` value.~~

title: Enable/Disable option for blocks
author: polyipseity
body:
**Overview**
An enable/disable option is added to every block except
> Blocks that are either distributors (Conveyor, Conduct, Power Node, etc.) or not meant to be disabled (Core, Command Center, etc.) do not provide an option to be disabled.

**Functions**
- It can be used to not let a system run before it is finished, which prevents item-clogging and then rebuilding the clogged parts.
- It can be used to save _items_, _liquid_ and _power_ when needed.
- _etc._

**Changes**

- When `configurable` is `true`, it will add enable/disable option.
To disable this behavior, override `Block.buildTable(Tile, Table)`.

- `Block.enable(Tile)` and `Block.disable(Tile)` are added.
`Block.enable(Tile)` is called when the block is being enabled (not on placing it).
`Block.disable(Tile)` is called when the block is being disabled.

- `TileEntity.enabled` is the `boolean` which shows whether it is enabled or disabled.

- This will break existing saves as of whether blocks are enabled is saved to saves now.

title: Adjustable core position
author: Timmeey86
body:
Refactored the previous pull request so it uses `int`s in the public interface. I opened a new pull request since I messed up the old branch. To sum it up again:
- Wave missions spawn the core in the center of the map by default
- Battle missions spawn the core at (50|50) by default
- Both mentioned mission types allow configuring a custom location.
- The tutorial sector spawns the core at (60|60) again like in previous versions (but is still disabled)

title: Proposal for configurable starting core position and fixing tutorial sector
author: Timmeey86
body:
Before this change, sectors with wave missions would always spawn their core in the center of the map. This however breaks the tutorial sector which has all its tutorials based on a core at (60, 60). 
This pull request is a proposal on how the tutorial sector could override the core location through lambda functions while maintaining the current behavior of default Wave and Battle missions.
The MissionWithStartingCore class was introduced in order to avoid modifying the constructors in other Mission subclasses which are not interested in Core positioning.
An alternative implementation would be to create a regular virtual function and create a special subclass for the Tutorial sector which overrides this function and provides a different tile.
A third, but more cumbersome implementation could leave the tutorial sector core in the center of the map, but shift all other missions to the new location.

title: Cultivator placement fix
author: Timmeey86
body:
This change makes sure that when trying to replace a block by another block of the same type (e.g. replacing any drill by a Cultivator), the replacement is not possible if the new block may not be built in this spot.
Otherwise, it would be possible to e.g. place a Cultivator on a non-grass resource field. That cultivator would then not produce anything since it is not actually placed on a grass tile.

title: Introduce workaround for libgdx issue by @codegist
author: Ameb
body:
libgdx has a [buggy piece of code](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/9e46b2768e06292f4c9c859ad95ae37bf52bd0ac/backends/gdx-backend-android/src/com/badlogic/gdx/backends/android/AndroidGraphics.java#L392) which introduces crashes into some devices. This happens in some devices as commented in libgdx/libgdx#4626.

Basically if the game is in foreground and you lock the screen the application gets killed by libgdx `AndroidGraphics` when resuming.
```
AndroidGraphics: waiting for pause synchronization took too long; assuming deadlock and killing
```
Luckily @codegist discussed a workaround in libgdx/libgdx#3861. This pull request adds the workaround to Mindustry.

title: File choosing assistance
author: cpaca
body:
When choosing files, what used to happen is if I, say, had a file named "A" and file named "a" they would not appear together because that is *technically* what alphabetical order says. Other than that, it would work just fine in "alphabetical" order, ABCDEFabcdef.  
However, in Mindustry font, caps and lower looks the same. So it looks really weird: ABCDEFABCDEF.  
  
This change makes it so it doesn't matter the caps/un-caps, it will sort the above files as AABBCCDDEEFF.  
(The slight problem comes when someone has two files with the same name but different caps at the start, but that seems like a less common problem, I feel.)  
  
That's the change that has been made here.  
I feel like it's fairly inefficient, so I hope you find a better source in the future.  
It also replaces a foreach loop with a fori loop, but there (might) be a better way to do it in the future.

title: Omnidrill will report unproductive base surface

title: Refactors to Liquids and Items
author: katepolak
body:
Changed both `Liquid` and `Item` enums to classes.

These classes contain the old enum members as static instances to minimize the impact of this change.

Possible future TODO:
- Remove the static item/liquid instances and move to completely dynamic setup.
- Make liquid tiles the color of their fluid.

title: Grammatical correction for remaining enemies label
author: skybldev
body:
Noticed that when the remaining enemy count comes down to 1, the word 'enemies' persists on the label, so i corrected that to show 'enemy' or 'enemies' instead, depending on the remaining enemy count. I also put 'left' after it to sort of bring back the more proper-sounding 'remaning' from back then, but it's shorter now to save space.
 
 Used to be: 
'3 ENEMIES'
'2 ENEMIES'
'1 ENEMIES' <doesn't sound right doesn't it?

Now:
'3 ENEMIES LEFT'
'2 ENEMIES LEFT'
'1 ENEMY LEFT' <sounds quite about right, and I even brought back the 'remaining' but shorter.

That's about it, and for a fact I'm really new to Java and am actively practicing it, using examples from yours' and other's code. It gets less complicated the more i look into it. :)

~~also first two dialogue/localization JSON coming soon~~
